widgets
Class MT3DObject

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.components.MTComponent
      widgets.AbstractGUIWidget
          widgets.MT3DObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.mt4j.components.interfaces.IMTComponent, org.mt4j.components.interfaces.IMTComponent3D, org.mt4j.input.IMTInputEventListener, org.mt4j.input.inputProcessors.IGestureEventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
MTContextModel3DObject, StdMT3DObject
public abstract class MT3DObject
extends AbstractGUIWidget

This class represents a 3D-object in the GUI context and encapsulates much of the 'hacking' you would need to create a visibility 3D-object with standard mt4j-commands.
Since a specific object can have multiple visual variants, this class enables you, to switch between these variants at runtime.
TODO: debug: some issues when moving the object upwards/downwards

Version:
20120529
Author:
langenhagen

scaleToUnit

public abstract float scaleToUnit(float multiplicator)
Scales this 3D-object to the unit multiplied a factor f, so it fits into a f*f square. Since mt4j doesn't support extracting the depth of a geometric object, the fitting is only guaranteed for the width and the height in GLOBAL coordinates.

Parameters:
multiplicator - The factor to multiply the scalation as a float
Returns:
Returns the factor used scale the 3D-object as a float

setMaterial

public abstract void setMaterial(org.mt4j.util.opengl.GLMaterial material)
Sets the material of this 3D-object to the specified one by setting this material to all submeshes of this 3D-object.

Parameters:
material - The material as a GLMaterial

getMaterials

public abstract java.util.List<org.mt4j.util.opengl.GLMaterial> getMaterials()
Gets all materials of this 3D-object.

Returns:
The materials as a List of GLMaterial

setVariant

public abstract boolean setVariant(int num)
Since one object in the smart-home GUI-context can have different visual modes, like a lamp which can be turned On or Off, or an object can simply have different visual styles, like different sorts of desks, you can switch between these styles by changing the number of the active variant. Variant-numbers are in sequential order, meaning that it may not be possible, that variant 1 and 3 exist, but 2 doesn't.

Parameters:
num - A variant's number as an int
Returns:
Returns TRUE, if the specified number is the number of a valid variant, otherwise it returns FALSE

getVariant

public abstract int getVariant()
Since one object in the smart-home GUI-context can have different visual modes, like a lamp which can be turned On or Off, or simply can have different visual styles, like different sorts of desks, you can switch between these styles by changing the number of the active variant using setVariant(). Variant-numbers are in sequential order, meaning, that it is not possible, that variant 1 and 3 exist, but 2 doesn't.
This method returns the number of the current active variant.

Returns:
The number of the current variant as an int

getNumOfVariants

public abstract int getNumOfVariants()
Since one object in the smart-home GUI-context can have different visual modes, like a lamp which can be turned On or Off, or simply can have different visual styles, like different sorts of desks, you can switch between these styles by changing the number of the active variant using setVariant().
This method returns the number of valid variants, which exist for this object. This number should be at least 1.

Returns:
The number of valid variants as an int.

getModelName

public abstract java.lang.String getModelName()
Retrieves the name of the 3D-model.

Returns:
The name of the 3D-model as a String

axis - The rotation axis as a Vector3D.
degree - The degrees to rotate in deg as a float.
space - The TransformSpace indicatiing the 3-dimensional space in which to rotate.
